ovn: Accept arrays for ovn_*_connection parameters

These parameters are regarded as StrOpt, but can accept comma-seprated
strings.

Change-Id: I725d7c167886ae799663bbe3c033fb99a81f9711

commit_message:
Fall back to alt path for ceph client data during export

The patch to fix the related bug (not this patch) fixes an
inconsistency where the ceph client data is somtimes exported
to the wrong path. If anyone deployed before they got the fix
to the related bug, then this patch will workaround that
problem if they export later.

When 'openstack overcloud export ceph' is run look in the
correct default location for the ceph client data and if it
is not found, then fall back to incorrect location.

Change-Id: I0b8c747481e561645eefea50cb77ca806a7f0de2
Related-Bug: #1978846
(cherry picked from commit fda3233451db678642fd57f920487db7ca63dc30)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/56/846556/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not os.path.exists(file): # fall back to old path if user had LP 1978846 during deployment file = "/home/stack/ceph_client.yaml"

commit_message:
Add handling for roles and networks to answers

The answers file only supports environments and templates today.
This change adds handling for roles and networks arguments. This
change will allow users to specify their roles_data.yaml and
network_data.yaml file in the same location as their other custom
templates.

Change-Id: I905999fd7901490aa87d3ab302b28b437225ed89
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/62/845062/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if 'roles' in answers: if parsed_args.roles_file is None: parsed_args.roles_file = answers['roles'] if 'networks' in answers: if parsed_args.networks_file is None: parsed_args.networks_file = answers['networks']

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I85ba622f5833f32d43552d06418a5356d1045272

commit_message:
Change naming (again) for networks and subnets.

There is a need for changing names again, since namespace id is no
longer stored in description and name for net/subnet is a compound of
name and uid.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kuryr-tempest-plugin/+/845745
Change-Id: Ib97a597f8afb47316e77154a9bf3ced41ce48468
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-tempest-plugin refs/changes/07/841107/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

... so that we can test both default values and overrides.

commit_message:
Add update capabilities to Snapshots

This patch aims to add the update operation to Snapshots.

Signed-off-by: Thiago Brito <thiago.brito@windriver.com>
Change-Id: I6c61ebf9605a7b62653d644dedddb56935ac016d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/60/778760/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def update_snapshot(self, snapshot, **attrs): """Update a snapshot :param snapshot: Either the ID of a snapshot or a :class:`~openstack.block_storage.v3.snapshot.Snapshot` instance. :attrs kwargs: The attributes to update on the snapshot represented by ``snapshot``. :returns: The updated server :rtype: :class:`~openstack.block_storage.v3.snapshot.Snapshot` """ return self._update(_snapshot.Snapshot, snapshot, **attrs)

commit_message:
Update port-mac-address-override shim extension

The port-mac-address-override shim extension proposed in
I54b4c85ffc4856fba7ad5e9e29f77f74815e1275 in neutron-lib has merged
and the neutron-lib has being released. So this patch updates the
API extension and replaces the import with the new neutron_lib api
definitions.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/831935

Change-Id: Ic332769af532003a9a5b2d2cee38b6210b5aac91
Related-Bug: #1942329
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/80/844680/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # TODO(gibi): replace the import with # from neutron_lib.api.definitions import port_mac_address_override # once https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/831935 merged and # neutron-lib is released from neutron.extensions import ( _port_mac_address_override as port_mac_address_override )

subject: Set "type=virtual" for OVN LSP with parent ports
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-06-15 09:38:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/2354a6ff83490ab267430c4258aa83eaf6755014', 'message': 'Set "type=virtual" for OVN LSP with parent ports

This is a follow-up of [1]. Before this patch, any virtual logical
switch port that was updated and the "device_owner" was not and empty
string, had its type set to '' (empty string).

This maintenance task, that is executed only once, lists all logical
switch ports, checks the presence or not of virtual parents and
sets the type to "virtual" if needed.

Related-Bug: #1973276

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/841711

commit_message:
Set "type=virtual" for OVN LSP with parent ports

This is a follow-up of [1]. Before this patch, any virtual logical
switch port that was updated and the "device_owner" was not and empty
string, had its type set to '' (empty string).

This maintenance task, that is executed only once, lists all logical
switch ports, checks the presence or not of virtual parents and
sets the type to "virtual" if needed.

Related-Bug: #1973276

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/841711

Conflicts:
    neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/maintenance.py
    neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/test_maintenance.py
    neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovn_client.py
    neutron/tests/unit/db/test_db_base_plugin_v2.py
    neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_portsecurity.py
    neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/test_mech_driver.py

Change-Id: I6cf1167d556f0c2c2aa2013f05c809648020b377
(cherry picked from commit 3c93da7bdf35c3be6081384b7f6d9a4ce13510d3)
(cherry picked from commit 316b55440ab7a2b27e0468a87545ee1db9e85b84)
(cherry picked from commit 29ef60c4c6ef7d973d361d5dcf4f29eef7a38183)

added_lines: # TODO(ralonsoh): Remove this in the Z+4 cycle @periodics.periodic(spacing=600, run_immediately=True) def update_port_virtual_type(self): """Set type=virtual to those ports with parents Before LP#1973276, any virtual port with "device_owner" defined, lost its type=virtual. This task restores the type for those ports updated before the fix https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/841711. """ if not self.has_lock: return context = n_context.get_admin_context() cmds = [] for lsp in self._nb_idl.lsp_list().execute(check_error=True): if lsp.type != '': continue port = self._ovn_client._plugin.get_port(context, lsp.name) for ip in port.get('fixed_ips', []): if utils.get_virtual_port_parents( self._nb_idl, ip['ip_address'], port['network_id'], port['id']): cmds.append(self._nb_idl.db_set( 'Logical_Switch_Port', lsp.uuid, ('type', ovn_const.LSP_TYPE_VIRTUAL))) break if cmds: with self._nb_idl.transaction(check_error=True) as txn: for cmd in cmds: txn.add(cmd) raise periodics.NeverAgain()

commit_message:
Fix compile_amphora_details when using UDP listeners

When requesting the amphora details of a LB that has a UDP listener, it
fails with an exception:

  AttributeError: 'KeepalivedLvs' object has no attribute
    'is_listener_running'

There's a typo in the _count_lvs_listener_processes function which calls
an inexisting method.

Change-Id: Id81ac8dfdd969c7b250d231123d392eff4a86269
(cherry picked from commit 655fdf8c1b5786c3aa24c926dd95537a51a7c0cc)

commit_message:
Move ``PortBindingChassisEvent`` checks to ``match_fn``

Moved the event checks to ``match_fn`` method, that is the correct
place to execute them, before the ``run`` method is called.

This is a follow-up of
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/842147.

Related-Bug: #1973347
Change-Id: I3b7c5d73d2b0d20fb06527ade30af8939b249d75
(cherry picked from commit 6890204765c5de1a91284b9b0b6bf0565673f53f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/53/845553/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def match_fn(self, event, row, old): return False return False return True def run(self, event, row, old):
deleted_lines: def run(self, event, row, old): return return

subject: Skip "PortBindingChassisEvent" if revision number changes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-06-13 07:09:49.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovsdb_monitor.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/base.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/resources/ovsdb/events.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/test_ovsdb_monitor.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/ace772787e9d00608c30b2dd321469c1ced8318c', 'message': 'Skip "PortBindingChassisEvent" if revision number changes

Since [1], the "external_ids" of the NB Logical_Router_Port register
are copied into the SB Port_Binding "external_ids". When a change
in a Port_Binding register is received, if only the
"external_ids:revision_number" is changed, we skip any update on the
related Logical_Router_Port.

If not, that will lead to an infinite loop: Neutron will update
the Logical_Router_Port with a new revision number and OVN will
copy this new revision number to the SB register, triggering again
the update of the NB Logical_Router_Port

[1]https://www.mail-archive.com/ovs-dev@openvswitch.org/msg62836.html

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/base.py

Closes-Bug: #1973347
Change-Id: Ib51764778a666050c42de0dfeb9bf9b185d44bb7
(cherry picked from commit 32e8303b3b21e047abcf365c3999cb7379467b0c)
(cherry picked from commit b7fb963d91af8247c5624d7f1753d5969658b616)
'}]
commit_message:
Skip "PortBindingChassisEvent" if revision number changes

Since [1], the "external_ids" of the NB Logical_Router_Port register
are copied into the SB Port_Binding "external_ids". When a change
in a Port_Binding register is received, if only the
"external_ids:revision_number" is changed, we skip any update on the
related Logical_Router_Port.

If not, that will lead to an infinite loop: Neutron will update
the Logical_Router_Port with a new revision number and OVN will
copy this new revision number to the SB register, triggering again
the update of the NB Logical_Router_Port

[1]https://www.mail-archive.com/ovs-dev@openvswitch.org/msg62836.html

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/base.py

Closes-Bug: #1973347
Change-Id: Ib51764778a666050c42de0dfeb9bf9b185d44bb7
(cherry picked from commit 32e8303b3b21e047abcf365c3999cb7379467b0c)
(cherry picked from commit b7fb963d91af8247c5624d7f1753d5969658b616)

added_lines: from neutron_lib.api.definitions import external_netfrom neutron.tests.functional.resources.ovsdb import events as test_eventsfrom neutron.tests.unit.api import test_extensions from neutron.tests.unit.extensions import test_l3class TestSBDbMonitor(base.TestOVNFunctionalBase, test_l3.L3NatTestCaseMixin): def setUp(self, **kwargs): super().setUp(**kwargs) self.chassis = self.add_fake_chassis('ovs-host1', enable_chassis_as_gw=True) self.l3_plugin = directory.get_plugin(plugin_constants.L3) ext_mgr = test_l3.L3TestExtensionManager() self.ext_api = test_extensions.setup_extensions_middleware(ext_mgr) self.handler = event.RowEventHandler() self.sb_api.idl.notify = self.handler.notify def _find_port_binding(self, port_type): rows = self.sb_api.db_find_rows( 'Port_Binding', ('type', '=', port_type)).execute(check_error=True) return rows[0] if rows else None def test_router_port_binding(self): # This test will check the router GW port creation and binding. def check_ext_ids(): pb = self._find_port_binding(ovn_const.OVN_CHASSIS_REDIRECT) _, lrp = list( self.nb_api.tables['Logical_Router_Port'].rows.data.items())[0] if pb.external_ids == {}: # The current version of OVN installed in FT CI could not have # [1]. In this case, the Port_Binding.external_ids value is an # empty dictionary. # [1]https://www.mail-archive.com/ovs-dev@openvswitch.org/ # msg62836.html return True return lrp.external_ids == pb.external_ids kwargs = {'arg_list': (external_net.EXTERNAL,), external_net.EXTERNAL: True} ext_net = self._make_network(self.fmt, 'ext_net', True, **kwargs) self._make_subnet(self.fmt, ext_net, '10.251.0.1', '10.251.0.0/24', enable_dhcp=True) router = self._make_router(self.fmt, self._tenant_id) row_event = test_events.WaitForCreatePortBindingEventPerType() self.handler.watch_event(row_event) self._add_external_gateway_to_router(router['router']['id'], ext_net['network']['id']) self.assertTrue(row_event.wait()) # Check SB pb.external_ids == NB lrp.external_ids port_binding = self._find_port_binding(ovn_const.OVN_CHASSIS_REDIRECT) self.sb_api.db_set('Port_Binding', port_binding.uuid, ('up', True)).execute(check_error=True) try: n_utils.wait_until_true(check_ext_ids, timeout=5) except n_utils.WaitTimeout: pb = self._find_port_binding(ovn_const.OVN_CHASSIS_REDIRECT) _, lrp = list( self.nb_api.tables['Logical_Router_Port'].rows.data.items())[0] self.fail('pb.ext_ids: %s -- lrp.ext_ids: %s' % (pb.external_ids, lrp.external_ids))

commit_message:
Disable crl file in non-pacemaker haproxy too

This is currently failing because the crl file does not exist:
    'unable to load /etc/pki/CA/crl/overcloud-crl.pem'

It is already disabled for pacemaker haproxy so for now disable it for
the non-pacemaker haproxy too.

Change-Id: If39af7eaaa90ec707a28214fbe650d0b0d5f9c2e
(cherry picked from commit e0a3385657081cbeffd298e191e609cf30a5d7a6)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/10/843510/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

When using `ManageNetworks: false` the gateway IPs are
empty string instead of `null` when not set. The YAQL
expression filters `null` values, but the empty string
value is included in the list. The ping gateway test end
up trying to run "ping $args $empty_string" which fails.

This change improves the yaql expression to also filter

Closes-Bug: #1973866
Change-Id: I7d8712223d077ab8e25239b891bd03a1324e01a8
(cherry picked from commit 7f6a4b43856246995b8fa26b833155559f95e2ca)

commit_message:
Filter empty string in PingTestGatewayIPsMap yagl

When using `ManageNetworks: false` the gateway IPs are
empty string instead of `null` when not set. The YAQL
expression filters `null` values, but the empty string
value is included in the list. The ping gateway test end
up trying to run "ping $args $empty_string" which fails.

This change improves the yaql expression to also filter
strings with 0 lenght.

Closes-Bug: #1973866
Change-Id: I7d8712223d077ab8e25239b891bd03a1324e01a8
(cherry picked from commit 7f6a4b43856246995b8fa26b833155559f95e2ca)
(cherry picked from commit ba7ef6b6ce6619e0c03f724abee2f41b9ca00ecf)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/52/846552/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixes an issue where gateway ping validations performed during deployment would fail. When setting the `ManageNetworks` parameter to `false` and no gateway was configured, the list of gateway IP addresses to ping would include empty strings for networks with no gateway. The validation would attempt to run a ping command without the address to ping, which caused the deployment to fail. See bug: `1973866 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1973866>`_.

commit_message:
Allow to provide custom configuration for VPNaaS

As we need to monitor vpn connection detailes, the only way to config vpnaas to log states and connections of vpn
is to provide own templates for VPNaaS configuration. With that we enable deployers to provide custom configuration
files for using with any vpn drivers (stronswan/openswan).

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ica203a6e21d3442bca4c621fae06e2f75d28eb3c

commit_message:
Remove overcloud config download command

The config download command no longer works with
ephemeral Heat. We can already achieve the same
functionality using overcloud deploy with the
--stack-only flag.

As such, this change is removing the no longer functional
config download command.

Change-Id: Ieb52658aaf9ebff95cec1dd80eaf2556e75eef8c

commit_message:
Disable trash purge scheduler

This patch introduces a boolean used to set the trash purge
schedule interval on the cinder related pools.
This is false by default and can be enabled via the tripleo
heat-templates interface.

Change-Id: I9b368da796ed6b3ccba13dc9430edb6bca8f91ea
(cherry picked from commit a449df417b36186ce4a97e8670226fedcf574a62)

commit_message:
WIP: Add support for glance-scrubber

Change-Id: Id261cc511038e38c8589aca28266c40e3ed1b3b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance refs/changes/17/823917/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper' provider_class = Puppet::Type.type(:glance_scrubber_config).provider(:openstackconfig) describe provider_class do it 'should default to the default setting when no other one is specified' do resource = Puppet::Type::Glance_scrubber_config.new( {:name => 'DEFAULT/foo', :value => 'bar'} ) provider = provider_class.new(resource) expect(provider.section).to eq('DEFAULT') expect(provider.setting).to eq('foo') end it 'should allow setting to be set explicitly' do resource = Puppet::Type::Glance_scrubber_config.new( {:name => 'dude/foo', :value => 'bar'} ) provider = provider_class.new(resource) expect(provider.section).to eq('dude') expect(provider.setting).to eq('foo') end it 'should ensure absent when <SERVICE DEFAULT> is specified as a value' do resource = Puppet::Type::Glance_scrubber_config.new( {:name => 'dude/foo', :value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>'} ) provider = provider_class.new(resource) provider.exists? expect(resource[:ensure]).to eq :absent end it 'should ensure absent when value matches ensure_absent_val' do resource = Puppet::Type::Glance_scrubber_config.new( {:name => 'dude/foo', :value => 'foo', :ensure_absent_val => 'foo' } ) provider = provider_class.new(resource) provider.exists? expect(resource[:ensure]).to eq :absent end end

commit_message:
Allow users to list all images

Add a "--all" option to "openstack image list", which allows the user to
list all of the images.

Story: 2010071
Change-Id: I56a2e4846d0380d07803305fb830d1a43dfd71b3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/82/656082/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: public_group.add_argument( "--all", dest="all", action="store_true", default=False, help=_("List all images"), ) if parsed_args.all: kwargs['all_'] = True

proxy: Resolve a TODO

Change-Id: Ie8aa8c095cc70a24bd20bda89aa7f91019ae9976
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/13/846213/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :param dict attrs: Attributes to be used to form the request URL such as the ID of a parent resource.
deleted_lines: # TODO(stephenfin): Update docstring for attrs since it's a lie :param dict attrs: Attributes to be passed onto the :meth:`~openstack.resource.Resource.delete` method, such as the ID of a parent resource.

subject: Move ``PortBindingChassisEvent`` checks to ``match_fn``
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-06-13 07:13:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/49e41dec210f350c0455da368de53473378f62a8', 'message': 'Move ``PortBindingChassisEvent`` checks to ``match_fn``

Moved the event checks to ``match_fn`` method, that is the correct
place to execute them, before the ``run`` method is called.

This is a follow-up of
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/842147.

Related-Bug: #1973347

commit_message:
Move ``PortBindingChassisEvent`` checks to ``match_fn``

Moved the event checks to ``match_fn`` method, that is the correct
place to execute them, before the ``run`` method is called.

This is a follow-up of
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/842147.

Related-Bug: #1973347
Change-Id: I3b7c5d73d2b0d20fb06527ade30af8939b249d75
(cherry picked from commit 6890204765c5de1a91284b9b0b6bf0565673f53f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/56/845556/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def match_fn(self, event, row, old): return False return False return True def run(self, event, row, old):
deleted_lines: def run(self, event, row, old): return return

commit_message:
Add more filter option of columns for server list -c COLUMN

In order to improve the convenient of use,
columns corresponding to the "--long" option has been added
so that it can be used in the filter.
Currently filterable columns include the following:
'ID', 'Name', 'Status', 'Networks', 'Image', 'Flavor'.

Story: 2009150
Task: 43113
Change-Id: I6760ca5da0e3707d1d746ae5eeec7d9162020d15

commit_message:
tests: Add test for bug #1936278

Ensure we're building the correct URL to talk to placement.

Change-Id: I2152ee77ba522b3925a6777e7f32a9943b76aa49
Related-Bug: #1936278
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/93/802893/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch.object(manage.PlacementCommands, '_check_orphaned_allocations_for_provider') @mock.patch('nova.scheduler.client.report.SchedulerReportClient.get') def test_audit_with_provider_uuid( self, get_resource_providers, check_orphaned_allocs, ): rps = [ { "generation": 1, "uuid": uuidsentinel.rp1, "links": None, "name": "rp1", "parent_provider_uuid": None, "root_provider_uuid": uuidsentinel.rp1, }, ] get_resource_providers.return_value = fake_requests.FakeResponse( 200, content=jsonutils.dumps({"resource_providers": rps})) # we found one orphaned allocation per RP and we had no faults check_orphaned_allocs.side_effect = ((1, 0), (1, 0)) ret = self.cli.audit( verbose=True, delete=False, provider_uuid=uuidsentinel.fake_uuid) # We found orphaned allocations but we left them self.assertEqual(3, ret) get_resource_providers.assert_called_once_with( f'/resource_providers?uuid={uuidsentinel.fake_uuid}', global_request_id=mock.ANY, version='1.14') # Only the specified RP is checked check_orphaned_allocs.assert_has_calls([ mock.call(mock.ANY, mock.ANY, mock.ANY, rps[0], False), ]) output = self.output.getvalue() self.assertIn('Processed 1 allocation', output) def test_audit_with_invalid_provider_uuid(self): self.cli, '_get_resource_provider', side_effect=exception.ResourceProviderNotFound( name_or_uuid=uuidsentinel.fake_uuid), ): get_resource_providers.assert_called_once_with( '/resource_providers', global_request_id=mock.ANY, version='1.14')

commit_message:
stop image downloads to memory

 + Fixes issue with large images hogging memory
 + stream image downloads
 + output to stdout if file not specified

Change-Id: Ia01ff9b21a2dac5d0ccf2bd58a8640e88c5cbb36
Story: 2007672
Task: 39776
(cherry picked from commit 5bdcd590ecacbc0aa8db2cbafa0ab1a9f3c28ce0)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/72/793572/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - Stream image download to avoid buffering data in memory which rapidly exhausts memory resulting in OOM kill or system crash for all but the smallest of images. Fixes https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2007672 - Restore default behavior of 'openstack image save' to send data to stdout Relates to https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2007672.

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I7feff566d290fbdb49d576c70012bd17d14724f5

commit_message:
Move ``PortBindingChassisEvent`` checks to ``match_fn``

Moved the event checks to ``match_fn`` method, that is the correct
place to execute them, before the ``run`` method is called.

This is a follow-up of
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/842147.

Related-Bug: #1973347
Change-Id: I3b7c5d73d2b0d20fb06527ade30af8939b249d75
(cherry picked from commit 6890204765c5de1a91284b9b0b6bf0565673f53f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/51/845551/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def match_fn(self, event, row, old): return False return False return True def run(self, event, row, old):
deleted_lines: def run(self, event, row, old): return return

subject: Skip "PortBindingChassisEvent" if revision number changes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-06-13 07:13:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/77bef3bc38031e394a79898ed14e7c928fe553e4', 'message': 'Skip "PortBindingChassisEvent" if revision number changes

Since [1], the "external_ids" of the NB Logical_Router_Port register
are copied into the SB Port_Binding "external_ids". When a change
in a Port_Binding register is received, if only the
"external_ids:revision_number" is changed, we skip any update on the
related Logical_Router_Port.

If not, that will lead to an infinite loop: Neutron will update
the Logical_Router_Port with a new revision number and OVN will
copy this new revision number to the SB register, triggering again
the update of the NB Logical_Router_Port

[1]https://www.mail-archive.com/ovs-dev@openvswitch.org/msg62836.html

commit_message:
Skip "PortBindingChassisEvent" if revision number changes

Since [1], the "external_ids" of the NB Logical_Router_Port register
are copied into the SB Port_Binding "external_ids". When a change
in a Port_Binding register is received, if only the
"external_ids:revision_number" is changed, we skip any update on the
related Logical_Router_Port.

If not, that will lead to an infinite loop: Neutron will update
the Logical_Router_Port with a new revision number and OVN will
copy this new revision number to the SB register, triggering again
the update of the NB Logical_Router_Port

[1]https://www.mail-archive.com/ovs-dev@openvswitch.org/msg62836.html

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/base.py
    neutron/tests/functional/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/test_ovsdb_monitor.py

Closes-Bug: #1973347
Change-Id: Ib51764778a666050c42de0dfeb9bf9b185d44bb7
(cherry picked from commit 32e8303b3b21e047abcf365c3999cb7379467b0c)
(cherry picked from commit b7fb963d91af8247c5624d7f1753d5969658b616)

added_lines: from neutron_lib.api.definitions import external_net from neutron_lib.api.definitions import portbindings from neutron_lib.plugins import constants as plugin_constants from neutron_lib.plugins import directory from ovsdbapp.backend.ovs_idl import event from ovsdbapp.backend.ovs_idl import idlutilsfrom neutron.tests.functional.resources.ovsdb import events as test_eventsfrom neutron.tests.unit.api import test_extensions from neutron.tests.unit.extensions import test_l3class TestSBDbMonitor(base.TestOVNFunctionalBase, test_l3.L3NatTestCaseMixin): def setUp(self, **kwargs): super().setUp(**kwargs) self.chassis = self.add_fake_chassis('ovs-host1', enable_chassis_as_gw=True) self.l3_plugin = directory.get_plugin(plugin_constants.L3) ext_mgr = test_l3.L3TestExtensionManager() self.ext_api = test_extensions.setup_extensions_middleware(ext_mgr) self.handler = event.RowEventHandler() self.sb_api.idl.notify = self.handler.notify def _find_port_binding(self, port_type): rows = self.sb_api.db_find_rows( 'Port_Binding', ('type', '=', port_type)).execute(check_error=True) return rows[0] if rows else None def test_router_port_binding(self): # This test will check the router GW port creation and binding. def check_ext_ids(): pb = self._find_port_binding(ovn_const.OVN_CHASSIS_REDIRECT) _, lrp = list( self.nb_api.tables['Logical_Router_Port'].rows.data.items())[0] if pb.external_ids == {}: # The current version of OVN installed in FT CI could not have # [1]. In this case, the Port_Binding.external_ids value is an # empty dictionary. # [1]https://www.mail-archive.com/ovs-dev@openvswitch.org/ # msg62836.html return True return lrp.external_ids == pb.external_ids kwargs = {'arg_list': (external_net.EXTERNAL,), external_net.EXTERNAL: True} ext_net = self._make_network(self.fmt, 'ext_net', True, **kwargs) self._make_subnet(self.fmt, ext_net, '10.251.0.1', '10.251.0.0/24', enable_dhcp=True) router = self._make_router(self.fmt, self._tenant_id) row_event = test_events.WaitForCreatePortBindingEventPerType() self.handler.watch_event(row_event) self._add_external_gateway_to_router(router['router']['id'], ext_net['network']['id']) self.assertTrue(row_event.wait()) # Check SB pb.external_ids == NB lrp.external_ids port_binding = self._find_port_binding(ovn_const.OVN_CHASSIS_REDIRECT) self.sb_api.db_set('Port_Binding', port_binding.uuid, ('up', True)).execute(check_error=True) try: n_utils.wait_until_true(check_ext_ids, timeout=5) except n_utils.WaitTimeout: pb = self._find_port_binding(ovn_const.OVN_CHASSIS_REDIRECT) _, lrp = list( self.nb_api.tables['Logical_Router_Port'].rows.data.items())[0] self.fail('pb.ext_ids: %s -- lrp.ext_ids: %s' % (pb.external_ids, lrp.external_ids))
deleted_lines: from neutron_lib.api.definitions import portbindings from neutron_lib.plugins import constants as plugin_constants from neutron_lib.plugins import directory from ovsdbapp.backend.ovs_idl import event from ovsdbapp.backend.ovs_idl import idlutils

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ib7952752dfbe3f72c46955d81051e0eb6a1fb5b3

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I371f9ad762dbc1edefe3719f10b1eabb34ae264f

commit_message:
Refactor "volume backup restore" command

Make the positional argument "volume" optional and add a "--force"
option (volume v2 only) to the "volume backup restore" command.

Closes-Bug: #1597189
Change-Id: If944e10158bd18e8331be63e96187a23e23095d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/31/353931/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [--volume <volume> | --name <name>].. option:: --volume <volume> Existing volume to restore to (name or ID) *Volume version 2 only* .. option:: --name <name> Name of a new volume to restore to (default to None) *Volume version 2 only* *Volume version 1 only*

commit_message:
Revert "compute: Move volume attached live migration tests to use SSHABLE"

This reverts commit 00bdb22cc31db962986ca910a909c0a25b3f590f.

Reason for revert: this test now fails while trying to clean up the validation resource.

Change-Id: I005755b0e527255362923a6b4bbbba2f7c1dfbd1
Closes-Bug: #1979052
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/51/846251/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # These tests don't attempt any SSH validation nor do they use # floating IPs on the instance, so all we need is a network and # a subnet so the instance being migrated has a single port, but # we need that to make sure we are properly updating the port # host bindings during the live migration. server = self.create_test_server(wait_until="ACTIVE")
deleted_lines: @classmethod def setup_credentials(cls): cls.prepare_instance_network() super(LiveMigrationTest, cls).setup_credentials() validation_resources = self.get_test_validation_resources( self.os_primary) server = self.create_test_server( validatable=True, validation_resources=validation_resources, wait_until="SSHABLE")

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ia8dd7b9843e036afb33dc4e1192c127105892407

subject: Skip "PortBindingChassisEvent" if revision number changes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-06-13 07:08:37.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovsdb_monitor.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/base.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/resources/ovsdb/events.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/test_ovsdb_monitor.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/b7fb963d91af8247c5624d7f1753d5969658b616', 'message': 'Skip "PortBindingChassisEvent" if revision number changes

Since [1], the "external_ids" of the NB Logical_Router_Port register
are copied into the SB Port_Binding "external_ids". When a change
in a Port_Binding register is received, if only the
"external_ids:revision_number" is changed, we skip any update on the
related Logical_Router_Port.

If not, that will lead to an infinite loop: Neutron will update
the Logical_Router_Port with a new revision number and OVN will
copy this new revision number to the SB register, triggering again
the update of the NB Logical_Router_Port

[1]https://www.mail-archive.com/ovs-dev@openvswitch.org/msg62836.html

commit_message:
Skip "PortBindingChassisEvent" if revision number changes

Since [1], the "external_ids" of the NB Logical_Router_Port register
are copied into the SB Port_Binding "external_ids". When a change
in a Port_Binding register is received, if only the
"external_ids:revision_number" is changed, we skip any update on the
related Logical_Router_Port.

If not, that will lead to an infinite loop: Neutron will update
the Logical_Router_Port with a new revision number and OVN will
copy this new revision number to the SB register, triggering again
the update of the NB Logical_Router_Port

[1]https://www.mail-archive.com/ovs-dev@openvswitch.org/msg62836.html

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/base.py

Closes-Bug: #1973347
Change-Id: Ib51764778a666050c42de0dfeb9bf9b185d44bb7
(cherry picked from commit 32e8303b3b21e047abcf365c3999cb7379467b0c)

added_lines: from neutron_lib.api.definitions import external_netfrom neutron.tests.functional.resources.ovsdb import events as test_eventsfrom neutron.tests.unit.api import test_extensions from neutron.tests.unit.extensions import test_l3class TestSBDbMonitor(base.TestOVNFunctionalBase, test_l3.L3NatTestCaseMixin): def setUp(self, **kwargs): super().setUp(**kwargs) self.chassis = self.add_fake_chassis('ovs-host1', enable_chassis_as_gw=True) self.l3_plugin = directory.get_plugin(plugin_constants.L3) ext_mgr = test_l3.L3TestExtensionManager() self.ext_api = test_extensions.setup_extensions_middleware(ext_mgr) self.handler = event.RowEventHandler() self.sb_api.idl.notify = self.handler.notify def _find_port_binding(self, port_type): rows = self.sb_api.db_find_rows( 'Port_Binding', ('type', '=', port_type)).execute(check_error=True) return rows[0] if rows else None def test_router_port_binding(self): # This test will check the router GW port creation and binding. def check_ext_ids(): pb = self._find_port_binding(ovn_const.OVN_CHASSIS_REDIRECT) _, lrp = list( self.nb_api.tables['Logical_Router_Port'].rows.data.items())[0] if pb.external_ids == {}: # The current version of OVN installed in FT CI could not have # [1]. In this case, the Port_Binding.external_ids value is an # empty dictionary. # [1]https://www.mail-archive.com/ovs-dev@openvswitch.org/ # msg62836.html return True return lrp.external_ids == pb.external_ids kwargs = {'arg_list': (external_net.EXTERNAL,), external_net.EXTERNAL: True} ext_net = self._make_network(self.fmt, 'ext_net', True, **kwargs) self._make_subnet(self.fmt, ext_net, '10.251.0.1', '10.251.0.0/24', enable_dhcp=True) router = self._make_router(self.fmt, self._tenant_id) row_event = test_events.WaitForCreatePortBindingEventPerType() self.handler.watch_event(row_event) self._add_external_gateway_to_router(router['router']['id'], ext_net['network']['id']) self.assertTrue(row_event.wait()) # Check SB pb.external_ids == NB lrp.external_ids port_binding = self._find_port_binding(ovn_const.OVN_CHASSIS_REDIRECT) self.sb_api.db_set('Port_Binding', port_binding.uuid, ('up', True)).execute(check_error=True) try: n_utils.wait_until_true(check_ext_ids, timeout=5) except n_utils.WaitTimeout: pb = self._find_port_binding(ovn_const.OVN_CHASSIS_REDIRECT) _, lrp = list( self.nb_api.tables['Logical_Router_Port'].rows.data.items())[0] self.fail('pb.ext_ids: %s -- lrp.ext_ids: %s' % (pb.external_ids, lrp.external_ids))

commit_message:
Set "type=virtual" for OVN LSP with parent ports

This is a follow-up of [1]. Before this patch, any virtual logical
switch port that was updated and the "device_owner" was not and empty
string, had its type set to '' (empty string).

This maintenance task, that is executed only once, lists all logical
switch ports, checks the presence or not of virtual parents and
sets the type to "virtual" if needed.

Related-Bug: #1973276

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/841711

Conflicts:
    neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/maintenance.py
    neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/test_maintenance.py
    neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovn_client.py
    neutron/tests/unit/db/test_db_base_plugin_v2.py
    neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_portsecurity.py
    neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/test_mech_driver.py

Change-Id: I6cf1167d556f0c2c2aa2013f05c809648020b377
(cherry picked from commit 3c93da7bdf35c3be6081384b7f6d9a4ce13510d3)

added_lines: # TODO(ralonsoh): Remove this in the Z+4 cycle @periodics.periodic(spacing=600, run_immediately=True) def update_port_virtual_type(self): """Set type=virtual to those ports with parents Before LP#1973276, any virtual port with "device_owner" defined, lost its type=virtual. This task restores the type for those ports updated before the fix https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/841711. """ if not self.has_lock: return context = n_context.get_admin_context() cmds = [] for lsp in self._nb_idl.lsp_list().execute(check_error=True): if lsp.type != '': continue port = self._ovn_client._plugin.get_port(context, lsp.name) for ip in port.get('fixed_ips', []): if utils.get_virtual_port_parents( self._nb_idl, ip['ip_address'], port['network_id'], port['id']): cmds.append(self._nb_idl.db_set( 'Logical_Switch_Port', lsp.uuid, ('type', ovn_const.LSP_TYPE_VIRTUAL))) break if cmds: with self._nb_idl.transaction(check_error=True) as txn: for cmd in cmds: txn.add(cmd) raise periodics.NeverAgain()

commit_message:
Set "type=virtual" for OVN LSP with parent ports

This is a follow-up of [1]. Before this patch, any virtual logical
switch port that was updated and the "device_owner" was not and empty
string, had its type set to '' (empty string).

This maintenance task, that is executed only once, lists all logical
switch ports, checks the presence or not of virtual parents and
sets the type to "virtual" if needed.

Related-Bug: #1973276

added_lines: # TODO(ralonsoh): Remove this in the Z+4 cycle @periodics.periodic(spacing=600, run_immediately=True) def update_port_virtual_type(self): """Set type=virtual to those ports with parents Before LP#1973276, any virtual port with "device_owner" defined, lost its type=virtual. This task restores the type for those ports updated before the fix https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/841711. """ if not self.has_lock: return context = n_context.get_admin_context() cmds = [] for lsp in self._nb_idl.lsp_list().execute(check_error=True): if lsp.type != '': continue port = self._ovn_client._plugin.get_port(context, lsp.name) for ip in port.get('fixed_ips', []): if utils.get_virtual_port_parents( self._nb_idl, ip['ip_address'], port['network_id'], port['id']): cmds.append(self._nb_idl.db_set( 'Logical_Switch_Port', lsp.uuid, ('type', ovn_const.LSP_TYPE_VIRTUAL))) break if cmds: with self._nb_idl.transaction(check_error=True) as txn: for cmd in cmds: txn.add(cmd) raise periodics.NeverAgain()

commit_message:
Create Yoga branch for OpenStack-Ansible roles

This release patch is to ensure, that trailing typed projects have been
branched for Yoga. The deadline for these deliverables is June 23rd.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this or update/-1
if something should be changed.

Change-Id: I895ad748193bf3ee170adc50e4950ac4e30dab0c

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/78/837378/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def list_snapmirror_snapshots(self, volume_name, newer_than=None, has_owners=True, is_busy=None): 'name': 'snapmirror*' snapshot_info_args = api_args['query']['snapshot-info'] if isinstance(is_busy, bool): snapshot_info_args['dependency'] = ('snapmirror|busy' if has_owners else '""') if newer_than: snapshot_info_args['access-time'] = '>' + newer_than if isinstance(is_busy, bool): snapshot_info_args['busy'] = 'true' if is_busy else 'false'
deleted_lines: def list_snapmirror_snapshots(self, volume_name, newer_than=None): 'dependency': 'snapmirror', if newer_than: api_args['query']['snapshot-info'][ 'access-time'] = '>' + newer_than

commit_message:
Add more complete examples with sample output

The existing examples from code are not sufficient to explain
how the various features of the module can be used. This patch
hopes to add more practical examples to show some of the
features.

Hopefully this also sets a trend so that more examples are added
in the future.

Change-Id: I035ce06a2391904724aaf8b0a724d7b4fa8e27f0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-config_template refs/changes/68/845768/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Examples -------- .ini or .conf ^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Playbook .. code-block :: yaml - hosts: localhost connection: local gather_facts: no tasks: - config_template: content: | [foo] bar = baz [section1] option1 = value1 dest: "test_dst.ini" ignore_none_type: false config_type: "ini" config_overrides: hello: cruel: world section1: option1: value2 listSection: listOption: - listItem1 - listItem2 multiStrOpsSection: multiStrOpsOption: ? multiStrOps1 ? multiStrOps2 Output .. code-block :: ini [foo] bar = baz [section1] option1 = value2 [hello] cruel = world [listSection] listOption = listItem1,listItem2 [multiStrOpsSection] multiStrOpsOption = multiStrOps1 multiStrOpsOption = multiStrOps2

commit_message:
Drop python3-networking-vmware-nsx from base neutron image

Probably copied from kolla when we moved to tcib.
And has been dropped from kolla since then[1].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/kolla/commit/a4f6a8f05b45838338ee1c6a78f278d49486ac03

Change-Id: I880185593c9566417bbbc713ba05b0f0b51ccc8c
(cherry picked from commit 58cd30d0a587cf3c8cbe94c8649f244a28bc2d01)

commit_message:
Add ceph_config_set before applying the spec

We need to make sure that the monitoring stack (or any other) container
images are set: apply spec is skipped with deployed ceph and that task
is never executed.
This patch adds the missing task on the main playbook, because we can't
execute these tasks during deployed ceph for two reasons:

1. deployed ceph has no clues about additional enabled services (tht is
   still the main user interface)

2. the tripleo variables to define the dashboard images are set via tht
   (external_deploy_steps)

Closes-Bug: #1977956
Change-Id: If642620e1cb285a2ac47c6ac09edd5abbb94b1ba
(cherry picked from commit b1c0ae795b7f83adf9086803fc3bcce2f74780cb)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/58/846258/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Set current ceph dashboard mgr backend fact

Due to a potential issue related to regex_replace combinated to an
ansible varialble value rendering, it's recommended setting the
fact and simplify the Ceph command that is supposed to set the backend.

Change-Id: I56d8862522fe82cb9f2373574ee067fbe4cae98d
(cherry picked from commit a2200b6eea3f8ff8ac1df34f523778d9426f9c75)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/56/846256/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: set_fact: current_mgr: "{{ ceph_mgr.stdout | regex_replace('^-n mgr.(.*)(?P<inst>) -f (.*)+$', '\\1') }}" - name: Check the resulting mgr container instance debug: msg: "{{ current_mgr }}" mgr mgr/dashboard/{{ current_mgr }}/server_addr \
deleted_lines: debug: msg: "{{ ceph_mgr.stdout | regex_replace('^-n mgr.(.*)(?P<inst>) -f (.*)+$', '\\1') }}" mgr mgr/dashboard/{{ ceph_mgr.stdout | regex_replace('^-n mgr.(.*)(?P<inst>) -f (.*)+$', '\\1') }}/server_addr \ changed_when: false

commit_message:
Set "type=virtual" for OVN LSP with parent ports

This is a follow-up of [1]. Before this patch, any virtual logical
switch port that was updated and the "device_owner" was not and empty
string, had its type set to '' (empty string).

This maintenance task, that is executed only once, lists all logical
switch ports, checks the presence or not of virtual parents and
sets the type to "virtual" if needed.

Related-Bug: #1973276

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/841711

Conflicts:
    neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/maintenance.py
    neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/test_maintenance.py
    neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovn_client.py
    neutron/tests/unit/db/test_db_base_plugin_v2.py
    neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_portsecurity.py
    neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/test_mech_driver.py

Change-Id: I6cf1167d556f0c2c2aa2013f05c809648020b377
(cherry picked from commit 3c93da7bdf35c3be6081384b7f6d9a4ce13510d3)
(cherry picked from commit 316b55440ab7a2b27e0468a87545ee1db9e85b84)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/09/845909/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(ralonsoh): Remove this in the Z+4 cycle @periodics.periodic(spacing=600, run_immediately=True) def update_port_virtual_type(self): """Set type=virtual to those ports with parents Before LP#1973276, any virtual port with "device_owner" defined, lost its type=virtual. This task restores the type for those ports updated before the fix https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/841711. """ if not self.has_lock: return context = n_context.get_admin_context() cmds = [] for lsp in self._nb_idl.lsp_list().execute(check_error=True): if lsp.type != '': continue port = self._ovn_client._plugin.get_port(context, lsp.name) for ip in port.get('fixed_ips', []): if utils.get_virtual_port_parents( self._nb_idl, ip['ip_address'], port['network_id'], port['id']): cmds.append(self._nb_idl.db_set( 'Logical_Switch_Port', lsp.uuid, ('type', ovn_const.LSP_TYPE_VIRTUAL))) break if cmds: with self._nb_idl.transaction(check_error=True) as txn: for cmd in cmds: txn.add(cmd) raise periodics.NeverAgain()

commit_message:
Reduce Heat engine workers

It conforms with API_WORKERS default calculation to avoid too much
processes consuming the memory.

Change-Id: If2b483711668715047662a286cb0f0e3b52bbdac
Signed-off-by: Cédric Ollivier <ollivier.cedric@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit a3be28bed790f2603dc59f8ad0d179183605d7ba)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/69/724969/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: HEAT_ENGINE_WORKERS=${HEAT_ENGINE_WORKERS:=$(( ($(nproc)/4)<2 ? 2 : ($(nproc)/4) ))} # reduce Heat engine workers iniset $HEAT_CONF DEFAULT num_engine_workers "$HEAT_ENGINE_WORKERS"

commit_message:
Fixed the repo generation code for ubi9

It fixes:
- Mirror map for ubi9, rhel9
- fallback to centos(8,9) if ubi(8,9) distros are used.
- Look for both ubi8 and ubi9 where ubi8 is previously defined.

Closes-Bug: #1979178

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I530b4671154e975d527cb380eda8304fec0a7f82
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-repos refs/changes/61/844361/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'ubi9': 'http://mirror.stream.centos.org', 'rhel9': 'https://trunk.rdoproject.org', if args.distro in ['ubi8', 'ubi9']: if args.distro in ['ubi8', 'ubi9']: distro = args.distro.replace('ubi', 'centos') # there are no base paths for UBI that work well if distro in ['ubi8', 'ubi9']:
deleted_lines: if args.distro == 'ubi8': if args.distro == 'ubi8': distro = 'centos8' # there are no base paths for UBI that work well if distro == 'ubi8':

subject: Fix creating ipsec site connection
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-06-14 13:50:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/4d88839040408ad08f925dea1ab7eca930df8233', 'message': 'Functions to get vpnservice and site connection in CONTEXT_READER

_get_vpnservice and _get_ipsec_site_connection need to be wrapped in
a CONTEXT_READER context manager to have them close their transactions.
Needed to avoid failing creation of ipsec site connections
because of errors of remove_reservation being called inside a
transaction.

Closes-Bug: #1978571
Change-Id: I6552816db8a596a933365dc9de481d8c32371f1c
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2022-06-14 17:04:21.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_vpnaas/tests/unit/services/vpn/service_drivers/test_ipsec.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/service_drivers/base_ipsec.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/db/vpn/vpn_db.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/740bf12dfa6850c84a3ce07c1a840ae113045f71', 'message': 'Fix creating ipsec site connection

Fixes a RuntimeError "Method remove_reservation cannot be called
within a transaction" while creating an ipsec site connection.
To avoid the error the service driver now gets the vpnservice
(to get the router_id) inside a CONTEXT_READER wrapper.

Closes-Bug: #1978571
Change-Id: I6552816db8a596a933365dc9de481d8c32371f1c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix creating ipsec site connection

Fixes a RuntimeError "Method remove_reservation cannot be called
within a transaction" while creating an ipsec site connection.
To avoid the error the service driver now gets the vpnservice
(to get the router_id) inside a CONTEXT_READER wrapper.

Closes-Bug: #1978571
Change-Id: I6552816db8a596a933365dc9de481d8c32371f1c

commit_message:
Remove support for Python 3.6 and 3.7

Maintaining support for older not supported in Zed Python versions
would take too much effort with a lot of libraries dropping
compatibility with 3.6 and 3.7

Change-Id: I24a8806012dea6fe379aa49fe061f1c6a2243a86

commit_message:
Format json output properly

str(dict) or print(dict) format a dict value into an invalid json
string because it uses single quotes(') instead of double quotes(").

This also fixes the log messages which mentions 'JSON' but doesn't
convert a dict value to a valid json string.

Conflicts:
	os_net_config/cli.py

Resolved conflict caused by da3bd5fbb8818743b96d7975f81907ed07409688 .

Closes-Bug: #1973566
Change-Id: I2398e3881310746f349e2c9a89c64956efbc13b2
(cherry picked from commit 88a4c885f6feec08209aebbb859f34957b952b26)
(cherry picked from commit bf263b66fb47f90892eb8e347322f5cf3808edb1)

commit_message:
Run all validations in check mode

By default command and shell modules are skipped in check mode.
However, the loop vars are checked which results in issue on
some ansible versions. We should be running all validations in
check mode.

Also bumps ansible-lint to fix tox-linters job failures.

Change-Id: I5152e9984d8170480f665da0493d85475b6bbcc9
Resolves: rhbz#2081361
(cherry picked from commit d3de75eb80595b38045d75ddbc8306418a290e4c)
(cherry picked from commit 5de3f03881d0b5eda62c58d468357f8fb8375efe)

commit_message:
Revert "task-core basic framework"

This reverts commit 6d809124049103f6c112ba75c0d1518ead2ae0fc.

Reason for revert: The decision was made to not pursue task-core and
directord. As such, these task-core methods are no longer required.

Change-Id: If3ec6485865755b584731835cdf866dc1feacfcb

commit_message:
[OVN] Use OVN from packages

This patch changes the OVN module from DevStack to allow for using the
OSapackaged version of OVN instead of compiling it from source.

A new variable called OVN_BUILD_FROM_SOURCE has been introduced and when
set to False (the default value) OVN will then use the packaged version
for setting up DevStack.

Note, in the stop_ovn() function, the OVN metadata agent service name
was wrong and the service wasn't being stopped as part of ./unstack.sh.
This patch also fixed it as well.

Change-Id: Ib41e3b486550200572afd6b3ba783d7644d70d44
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Slawek Kaplonski <skaplons@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit e651d9ef8840bb7dd497b557125ce1cd5290993d)

commit_message:
doc: provide information about 3rdparty repos

Kolla project images cover several distributions on multiple
architectures. Not all packages come from distribution repositories.

This patch adds documentation about such cases.

Change-Id: I870aa6acd875fc1425f25a435f0701850cf97285
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/21/845921/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: =========================== Versions of used components =========================== Kolla project images cover several distributions on multiple architectures. Not all packages come from distribution repositories. Table below tries to provide information about those which come from 3rdparty sources. ============== ================ ============================================= Name Minimal Version Package source information ============== ================ ============================================= Elasticsearch 7.10 `Elasticsearch install guide`_ Logstash 7.9 `Logstash install guide`_ Kibana 7.10 `Kibana install guide`_ InfluxDB 1.8.10 `InfluxDB upstream repo`_ Telegraf 1.23.0 `InfluxDB upstream repo`_ TD Agent 4.3.1 `TreasureData install guide`_ ProxySQL 2.3 `ProxySQL repository`_ HAProxy 2.2 - CentOS: "NFV extras" distro repository - Debian: distro repository - Ubuntu 20.04: `HAProxy PPA`_ Erlang 24.3 - CentOS: `PackageCloud modern Erlang`_ - Debian/Ubuntu: `Cloudsmith.io modern Erlang`_ Rabbitmq 3.9.20 - CentOS: `PackageCloud modern Erlang`_ - Debian/Ubuntu: `Cloudsmith.io modern Erlang`_ Grafana 9.0 `Grafana install guide`_ OpenVSwitch 2.15 - CentOS: "NFV extras" distro repository - Debian/Ubuntu: distro repository QEMU 6.2 - CentOS: distro repository - Debian: 'backports' distro repository - Ubuntu 22.04: distro repository libvirt 8.0 - CentOS: distro repository - Debian: 'backports' distro repository - Ubuntu 22.04: distro repository MariaDB 10.6 (LTS) `MariaDB Community downloads`_ ============== ================ ============================================= .. _`InfluxDB upstream repo`: https://repos.influxdata.com/ .. _`Elasticsearch install guide`: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/7.10/install-elasticsearch.html .. _`Kibana install guide`: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/kibana/7.10/install.html .. _`Logstash install guide`: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/logstash/7.9/installing-logstash.html .. _`TreasureData install guide`: https://www.fluentd.org/download .. _`ProxySQL repository`: https://repo.proxysql.com/ProxySQL/proxysql-2.3.x/ .. _`HAProxy PPA`: https://launchpad.net/~vbernat/+archive/ubuntu/haproxy-2.2 .. _`Cloudsmith.io modern Erlang`: https://www.rabbitmq.com/install-debian.html#apt-cloudsmith .. _`PackageCloud modern Erlang`: https://www.rabbitmq.com/install-rpm.html#package-cloud .. _`Grafana install guide`: https://grafana.com/grafana/download?platform=linux&edition=oss .. _`MariaDB Community downloads`: https://mariadb.com/downloads/community/

commit_message:
Fix None comparision when sorting by `updated_at`

When sorting resource candidates in `_get_best_existing_rsrc_db`,
resources with the same score are sorted by `updated_at`, which can be
`None`. If that is the case, use `created_at` instead.

(victoria to ussuri)
Conflicts:
	heat/tests/test_convg_stack.py

Resolved conflict caused by the following commit.

commit fd6cf83554db68752278d37f577ba984d9f831b2
    Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Task: 43815
Story: 2009653
Change-Id: Ic0265fcf7ceb811803cdebaa8932fe80dc59a627
(cherry picked from commit 403fa55fe94ae1063d2cb4b8db3b63b76b1ee5cf)
(cherry picked from commit 5ea5276a3e76829fd72345e3aae7482cbd260b51)
(cherry picked from commit aa31864de4fe480674a0669c05a024ab28c3c429)
(cherry picked from commit 26a20de88c0b578422e9847c1210d10f10b04854)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/97/837697/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: last_changed_at = ext_rsrc.updated_at if last_changed_at is None: last_changed_at = ext_rsrc.created_at return score, last_changed_at

commit_message:
Fix error message when git clone fails

1. There was no %s for the image.name
2. The image name is in the logger, so the source is more useful (which
   may be a plugin or addition)

TrivialFix

Change-Id: If95a8a41d2caf6738d4ccb9ddb651a06018743f4

commit_message:
Ignore unreachable errors for scale playbook

We need to continue with scale tasks if some nodes are
unreachable. Looks like ansible returns "Return Code: 4" [1]
for unreachable nodes, let's ignore that.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/devel/lib/ansible/executor/task_queue_manager.py#L103

Change-Id: Iea2022bf8dd27eb8762158c04cd3e0186da4fe0c

commit_message:
[OpenStackAnsible Roles] Transition Pike to End of Life

This transition the Pike branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The pike branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/pike is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Change-Id: Iaf4fdd8bf43c13c73ea7b2b35b50d457a9fada37

commit_message:
Fall back to alt path for ceph client data during export

The patch to fix the related bug (not this patch) fixes an
inconsistency where the ceph client data is somtimes exported
to the wrong path. If anyone deployed before they got the fix
to the related bug, then this patch will workaround that
problem if they export later.

When 'openstack overcloud export ceph' is run look in the
correct default location for the ceph client data and if it
is not found, then fall back to incorrect location.

Change-Id: I0b8c747481e561645eefea50cb77ca806a7f0de2
Related-Bug: #1978846

commit_message:
Remove [keystone] configuration block

The [keystone] configuration block no longer exists in ironic.conf
and was deprecated in Queens. Use 'region_name' option in the
following sections - '[service_catalog]', '[neutron]', '[glance]',
'[cinder]', '[swift]' and '[inspector]' to configure region for those
services individually.

Change-Id: I40a073f9aa6e40f35dffab6223308a18fa98e7ac

commit_message:
ovn: add network group to neutron-ovn-metadata-agent

According to OVN SRIOV docs [1] - neutron-ovn-metadata-agent needs
to be deployed on network nodes (OVN chassis).

[1]: https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/admin/ovn/sriov.html

Change-Id: I111df79f08eb76a735f33c6edf03b5a302fb6cc3

commit_message:
Migrate scenario 005 job to CentOS Stream 9

This is follow-up of 6f090cc74d0eaa6ae835864ff70856bd1e812efc and moves
the new scenario005 job to CentOS Stream 9, as RDO no longer supports
CentOS 8 Stream for Zed.

commit_message:
Bump skydive version to 0.28

Skydive versions prior to 0.28.0 panic on newer versions of libc.
Fixed upstream in 0.28, see: https://github.com/skydive-project/skydive/issues/2329
This should be backported to at least xena and yoga, as skydive is
currently not working with centos 8 on these releases.

Closes-Bug: #1940862
Change-Id: I177949b9319a977c9cd9121eb28b710256b72a5a

commit_message:
Update python testing as per zed cycle teting runtime

In Zed cycle, we have dropped the python 3.6/3.7[1] testing
and its support. Removing the py36 centos8 job as well as
updating the python classifier also to reflect the same.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/zed.html

Change-Id: Id708ac888f5b0f8a2cb0e7964b2857a351a3fb70

commit_message:
Fix resource references between property and bundle resource

Currently node properties are configured during step 2 while bundle
resources are configured during step 5. Thus bundle resources are not
declared when node properties are declared, and the current reference
from property to bundle resource results in broken reference.

Change-Id: I540a1b0b4c17af882c3312aeb7bc6ec5ea02192f

commit_message:
Use constraints when creating tempest venv

When running tempest we run in-tree tests as well. Lots of these
tests including tempest tests may not work with new client
libraries. Let's use the relevant branch upper constraints when
running functional tests.

Backport note:
Change I7d1017bcd7147329c4e187336daee1a1ae280fa9, which replaced f33
by f66, is merged into this backport to unblock CI.

Backport notes to ussuri:
- Change I703229320320295b4a90e72c543f8959f85daaa9, which removed l-c
  job is merged into this backport because the job is failing now.
- Change Ibe60d1e536f0e887eceea32b7cb4eec6318e96af is partially pulled
  into this change to fix the requirements-check job.
- This change was adjusted to avoid config error in zuul. The grenade
  job is already made non-voting in stable/ussuri.

Backport note to train:
- Resolved conflicts caused by zuul v3 migration.

Change-Id: I6a8cffdc86c895eebe4269c5cd37841325566c54

commit_message:
WIP: Add new volume transaction tracking

This is a draft to initiate discussions related to allowing an operator
see what cinder is actively working on at any point in time.

Change-Id: Ibde8289d51db474df00f211e8c40223606e9b61a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/76/845176/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Transaction Tracking ========================================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/example Cinder currently doesn't keep track of what it's doing internally with respect to volume transactions. There is no way to know if cinder is busy with a long running process, such as backup, migration, create from image, etc as well as how many transactions are currently in process. This is problematic for several reasons and can lead to volume state inconsistencies. As an operator, I want to know what cinder is doing at any given time. Tailing the log file isn't sufficient. There should be a 'top' like cinder client command where the operator can watch what volume transactions are taking place and when they complete. This would be a useful step towards safely restarting the cinder volume/backup service. Problem description =================== First I would like to define the term 'volume transaction'. A volume transaction is where cinder processes a request to do work on a volume until the work is completed or errored out. This can be a long running process and/or many steps from the API injestion to completion/error. Such as API -> scheduler -> manager -> driver to complete a user requested task to create a volume. For example the creation of a volume starts with the Cinder API service receiving a request to create a volume. The Cinder API does some minimal validation, then calls the volume api to create the volume. The volume api does some more validation then calls the scheduler's task flow engine to create the volume. The scheduler's task flow runs creates the spec and then runs the request through the scheduler, which then calls the volume manger's task flow to create the volume. The volume manager's task flow calls the driver to create the volume. There are other paths that a volume create can take, especially if it's create from an existing volume, or snapshot or image. Each stage of this process is part of the volume transaction. The volume transaction is completed once the volume is created or the processing errors out. This complex processing of the transaction should be tracked by cinder so that an operator can see which transactions are still outstanding and how many there are. Think linux top command. This same transaction tracking would be a starting point for graceful shutdown and then eventually restarting transactions that aren't complete during the next cinder start. Problems for operators happen when cinder is restarted in the middle of the volume transaction. This can lead to volume state inconsistencies or states that are stuck, such as creating, migrating, attaching. The operator is left to track down what part of the transaction the volume was in and then reset the state of the volume to something that another transaction can be done on the volume, such as delete. Use Cases ========= An operator wants to monitor cinder's current transactions to see if they can safely shutdown cinder. Proposed change =============== Create a DB transactions table to track: transaction type (create, delete, migrate, backup), state, progress, host, volume id, Alternatives ------------ Currently, tailing the api, scheduler, volume, backup logs to see if cinder is 'busy' doing anything. An alternative is to create a transaction project, that can be used by any openstack project to track transactions. Cinder would use an API of some sort to call the transaction API to log transaction state. This seems overkill and outside the scope of the cinder project. Data model impact ----------------- New DB table(s) for tracking the transactions. Do we need multiple tables? REST API impact --------------- Would need a new API for asking for the current list of non completed transactions. This could be used by the cinder client to provide a point in time list and/or a 'live' view of running transactions. Security impact --------------- meh Active/Active HA impact ----------------------- hard Notifications impact -------------------- Would be nice to have notifications support for start of the transaction as well as completion. Cinder currently supports some start/end processing of request notifications, but this new transaction tracking mechanism could unify notifications for all volume transactions. Other end user impact --------------------- Aside from the API, are there other ways a user will interact with this feature? * Does this change have an impact on python-cinderclient? What does the user interface there look like? Performance Impact ------------------ Would need to be able to clean up the transactions table for completed transactions, or querying the db table might get slow over time. Other deployer impact --------------------- Developer impact ---------------- Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Who is leading the writing of the code? Or is this a blueprint where you're throwing it out there to see who picks it up? If more than one person is working on the implementation, please designate the primary author and contact. Primary assignee: <launchpad-id or None> Other contributors: <launchpad-id or None> Work Items ---------- Work items or tasks -- break the feature up into the things that need to be done to implement it. Those parts might end up being done by different people, but we're mostly trying to understand the timeline for implementation. Dependencies ============ * Include specific references to specs and/or blueprints in cinder, or in other projects, that this one either depends on or is related to. * If this requires functionality of another project that is not currently used by Cinder (such as the glance v2 API when we previously only required v1), document that fact. * Does this feature require any new library dependencies or code otherwise not included in OpenStack? Or does it depend on a specific version of library? Testing ======= Please discuss how the change will be tested. We especially want to know what tempest tests will be added. It is assumed that unit test coverage will be added so that doesn't need to be mentioned explicitly, but discussion of why you think unit tests are sufficient and we don't need to add more tempest tests would need to be included. Is this untestable in gate given current limitations (specific hardware / software configurations available)? If so, are there mitigation plans (3rd party testing, gate enhancements, etc). Documentation Impact ==================== What is the impact on the docs team of this change? Some changes might require donating resources to the docs team to have the documentation updated. Don't repeat details discussed above, but please reference them here. References ========== Please add any useful references here. You are not required to have any reference. Moreover, this specification should still make sense when your references are unavailable. Examples of what you could include are: * Links to mailing list or IRC discussions * Links to notes from a summit session * Links to relevant research, if appropriate * Related specifications as appropriate (e.g. link to any vendor documentation) * Anything else you feel it is worthwhile to refer to To ensure that references do not cause duplicate label issues with other existing issues use the following example references [1]_ or `example reference`_. .. [1] This is the first reference _`example reference`: Second reference

commit_message:
Add a new scenario to test ml2+ovn

This introduces a new scenario (005) to integration tests to cover
ml2+ovn, because ml2+ovn is now the default plugin/mechanism driver
used by Neutron.

Change-Id: I15b52f34c6bff9aa68e9abbecc261af50d59e393

subject: Bindep fixes for SUSE-like systems
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-06-03 14:06:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/a8c077f1d3c9afd47b95aa1db7b13a16e164e6b0', 'message': 'Multiple bindep fixes

- libpython3-dev is not required for dpkg-based systems
- on SUSE-like systems, qemu-img is provided by qemu-tools
- on SUSE-like systems, pg_config is provided by postgresql-server-devel

Change-Id: Ia0e5f52f3841b3306a8776762d18a56c6df1e2f5
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2022-06-15 21:09:18.000000000', 'files': ['bindep.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/53f322f1d8c0a5c1e8c494f88f1f05c47b29729a', 'message': 'Bindep fixes for SUSE-like systems

- qemu-img is provided by qemu-tools
- pg_config is provided by postgresql-server-devel

Closes-Bug: #1978869
Change-Id: Ia0e5f52f3841b3306a8776762d18a56c6df1e2f5
'}]
commit_message:
Bindep fixes for SUSE-like systems

- qemu-img is provided by qemu-tools
- pg_config is provided by postgresql-server-devel

Closes-Bug: #1978869
Change-Id: Ia0e5f52f3841b3306a8776762d18a56c6df1e2f5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/96/844596/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: postgresql-server-devel [platform:suse] # Provides pg_configqemu-img [platform:redhat] qemu-tools [platform:suse] # Provides qemu-img

subject: Remove duplicate on_config hook register
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-06-07 03:19:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-ops-openstack/commit/f8c99307a9d62852e367c55c2382b9550772f98b', 'message': 'Misc fixes to charm base classes

- CinderStoragePluginCharm should not register self.on_config
  as a hook, because the parent class already will call this
  on config changed.
- Treat empty string as unset for the purposes of
  checking mandatory config values.
  This appears to be the behaviour expected by field engineers.
- Add some TODO comments to be resolved before merge.

Change-Id: I202ad2134e6d56881213a63899e7afda1cc0de00
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2022-06-08 02:30:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-ops-openstack/commit/96511690995e0f0c4cb2665c0b7f5a846e247cfa', 'message': 'Misc fixes to charm base classes

- CinderStoragePluginCharm should not register self.on_config
  as a hook, because the parent class already will call this
  on config changed.
- Treat empty string as unset for the purposes of
  checking mandatory config values.
  This appears to be the behaviour expected by field engineers.

Change-Id: I202ad2134e6d56881213a63899e7afda1cc0de00
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2022-06-09 22:07:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-ops-openstack/commit/7842571fe69badd66eb8ebd1e99e8c60abcb5fd8', 'message': 'Remove duplicate on_config hook register

CinderStoragePluginCharm should not register self.on_config

commit_message:
Remove duplicate on_config hook register

CinderStoragePluginCharm should not register self.on_config
as a hook, because the parent class method already will call this
on config changed (OSBaseCharm._on_config).

(also add new tox test targets to keep zuul happy)

Change-Id: I202ad2134e6d56881213a63899e7afda1cc0de00
